Articles.Content:
We all are (at least I am) are excited about the possibility of career mode in upcoming versions.

So I was interested to see if any of you guys have been doing some "career" missions. That is designing simple (but realistic) craft, trying to recover parts/minimizing space debris, you know all that real-space-programmy stuff. Will be posting my own missions tommorow.

We all are (at least I am) are excited about the possibility of career mode in upcoming versions.

So I was interested to see if any of you guys have been doing some "career" missions. That is designing simple (but realistic) craft, trying to recover parts/minimizing space debris, you know all that real-space-programmy stuff. Will be posting my own missions tommorow.

Actually I have been working on something... Recently I had developed a series of lifters called the "Titan" which has enough TWR and DeltaV to get 58 tons to LKO, however upon testing it I discovered that it could get the 58 tons up there with fuel to spare. Keeping this in mind I modified the design to add a set of landing legs and tested if that extra fuel was enough to perform a powered landing back on Kerbin, and sure enough it was!

However that lifter was 3 stages, 2 sets of 2 boosters, and a central stack. With that design only the central stack could come and land back at KSC, so that has inspired me to invest some time in developing and testing an SSTO lifter system that can get to orbit, drop off it's payload, and then land back at KSC fully intact. It will also have a docking port instead of decoupler so that it can be re-fueled and have a new payload set on top of it. (Sort of like a modular cargo system)

I'll be starting work on this tonight, and hopefully in the end I will come up with a completely reusable launch vehicle.

EDIT: On a side note having a reusable launch vehicle would be invaluable, especially with the whole "budget" thing.

Edited August 16, 2013 by CoriW

Not really "missions" but more like random "goals". For instance, tonight I am working on a single-launch-Apollo-style-to-Dres vehicle, and it is proving to be a bear of a problem to solve. The transfer stage, CSM, and DM are all built and ready, using proven techniques that I know work. Stacking them correctly and getting them to orbit is the issue.

Last night I sent my Moho rover and Eeloo satellite on their way. They're both built with 1.25m parts.

It's challenges and exercises like these that I figure will prepare me best for the unknown quantity of career mode. Seriously, we have no idea what recovery and funding will look like, and we're only starting to see how a tech tree will function. It's still a long way off and I'm not going to try anticipating how it will actually play since the surprise of it is part of the discovery and joy of gaming.
I have been. I tried doing my best in this mission to keep aerodynamically logic rockets, leave no debris behind and not do some weird stuff. Basically trying to call this a "real" mission.
there is a plugin called mission controller extended FYI

I just completed my Evil Overlord mission to Jool

Mission profile was fairly light. A low weight gantry with 5 "Minion" probes transported to jool followed by a hab unit and an extra fuel storage. All systems sent without crew and Overlord to remain in orbit for future use when the Ares mission at duna start being self supporting.

Here is Overlord. You can see one of the Minion's on the top right gentry. The bay doors are open to show the return vehicle storage bay. Both that section and the large lower central tank are brought up separately. On the flip side is a Kethane converter and storage tanks for future missions

I do have a KAS system on there just in case, but the two large docks and 4 standard docks are the primary connection points.

LoX storage is 9k/11k

Power 6.5k units

Mono 750 units

Kethane 4k units

Crew cap without escape vehicle 6 short term/ 3 long term With escape module 10 short/5 long

Mission length

aprox 3 years.

All three parts were launched 45 days apart with the final lift putting that ship 4 days from orbital transfer, all ships left together at that point, rendezvousing at Tylo for orbit and docking up. After docking all expendable and expended parts able to be jettisoned were shot off for hopeful Tylo capture and crash landing (Still have a few bits and bobs sharing my orbit... not making me happy.)

Once all the station was combined the Minions were deployed whenever the moons were closest (As you can see I haven't gotten bop's sent out yet... being a bit lazy about it.)

Now I just have to get Duna set up and sent out.

Alacrity
